intro: Cattleya pygmaea, commonly known as the miniature cattleya, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact size, typically growing to a height of only 10–15 centimeters. The plant features showy, fragrant flowers that are usually pale yellow to orange in color, with a distinctive dark lip. It thrives in warm, humid environments with bright, indirect light. Cattleya pygmaea is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
